description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Guernsey updates - BBC News
maintext:
The over 65s and anyone shielding from coronavirus should make a personal decision about what they want to do, Dr Nicola Brink said.
The director of Public Health emphasised that given their higher risk of severe illness, anyone considering expanding their activities who is "particularly vulnerable" should also consult with their doctor.
She added: "Some people don't want to spend the next however many months isolated.
"That may be really impacting on their overall wellbeing, so we're trying to take that holistic approach.
"Make a decision that's right for you, I really think personal responsibility and personal decision making, allowing people to make a decision that's right for them, is important."
